JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Margarita Tsatsa-Nikolovska;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Snejana Botoucharova;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON , and PERSON , are citizens of GPE who were born in DATE respectively . They are currently serving their prison sentences respectively in GPE and GPE prisons ( GPE ) . They were represented before the ORG by PERSON V. Vlk , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG . ORG did not make use of their right to intervene ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Convention ) .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE a police intervention unit entered the first applicant ’s cottage on suspicion that he had raped a certain PERSON broke out , during which the first applicant was seriously injured . The applicants were charged with attempted murder of the police officers . The first applicant was also charged with rape . He was hospitalised and the second applicant was detained . In the course of the investigation it became apparent that PERSON had invented the story of the rape and that the police had already been aware of that on DATE .
i. Proceedings for the protection of the first applicant ’s personal rights

On DATE the first applicant filed with ORG ( městský soud ) an action for the protection of his personal rights against ORG claiming CZK MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL ) as compensation for non - pecuniary damages . It appears that the proceedings are still pending .
ii . Procedure for the protection of the second applicant ’s personal rights

On DATE the second applicant and a certain PERSON filed with ORG an action for the protection of their personal rights and payment of reasonable satisfaction . The court dismissed their action in a judgment of DATE which was upheld by ORG ( Vrchní soud ) on DATE .
On DATE the applicant requested to reopen the proceedings .
iii . Proceedings for damage to health , business losses brought by the first applicant

On DATE the first applicant filed an action for damages against ORG . On DATE and DATE respectively , ORG ( okresní soud ) interrupted the proceedings pending the outcome of the proceedings for the protection of the applicant ’s personal rights ( i. ) . It appears that the proceedings have not yet been terminated .
iv . Proceedings for compensation for the expenses incurred in criminal proceedings

On DATE the applicants brought CARDINAL actions against ORG and ORG before ORG for compensation for the expenses they had incurred in the criminal proceedings . On DATE the court terminated the proceedings following the applicants’ withdrawals of their actions . Both decisions became final on DATE .
v. Proceedings for material damages initiated by the first applicant
On DATE the first applicant brought proceedings before ORG against ORG , claiming material damages of CZK MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) .
On DATE ORG interrupted the proceedings pending the outcome of the proceedings for the protection of the applicant ’s personal rights ( i. ) . It appears that the proceedings remain pending .
vi . Proceedings for protection of personal rights of both applicants

On DATE the applicants brought proceedings for protection of their personal rights against ORG before ORG . ORG ( PERSON státní zastupitelství ) , ORG ( krajské státní zastupitelství ) and PERSON District Prosecutor ’s Office ( okresní státní zastupitelství ) joined the proceedings later on .

The court dismissed their action in a judgment of DATE which was quashed by ORG in respect of the first applicant . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG partly granted the first applicant ’s action , dismissing the rest of his claims . On DATE ORG modified this judgment in that it dismissed the successful part of the applicant ’s action . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed the first applicant ’s appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) . His constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) was rejected by ORG ( GPE soud ) on DATE .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
